programme.desc: Warden Marshall leads the charge on a poaching investigation. Warden Richards visits an allegedly illegal snake breeder. Wardens Gould and Hickerson try to save an injured pelican, while Warden Miller brings a caracara bird to rehab.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch: Bloodline
programme.desc: The discovery of mysterious fishing charts on the Cornelia Maria leads co-captains Josh Harris and Casey McManus to Hawaii to learn what Josh's late father, Captain Phil Harris, was attempting to accomplish decades ago.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch: Bloodline
programme.desc: Josh, Casey and Jeff travel to the southern edge of Kona's fishing grounds a spot Phil Harris frequently explored. Despite the rough waters and unpredictable weather, the trio dives into Kona's shark-infested waters to learn what kept Phil coming back.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch: Bloodline
programme.desc: Josh and his crew get an opportunity to supply ahi and mahi to a local restaurant and hope Phil's notes will lead them to a big payday. It's their first chance to turn a profit but if they want to succeed, they must first learn the Hawaiian way.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch: Bloodline
programme.desc: On Hawaii's Big Island, Josh enlists the help of Johnathan Hillstrand to help him dive deeper into the mystery of Phil's charts and gain insight into the time Phil spent in Kona Town.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Captains scramble to meet an expanded quota in the path of a violent system dubbed 'Squall-pocalypse.' A breakdown on the Wizard puts Monte in debt to the Time Bandit and Josh and Casey exceed their own quota when it comes to injuries on deck.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: An Arctic storm blasts the fleet as Sig ventures to deep waters he hasn't fished in 17 years. Johnathan steers the Time Bandit into 30-foot waves in a hail Mary run toward Russia. Captain Keith attempts a risky maneuver to save the Wizard's pots.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Josh and Casey follow a blind tip from an unknown fisherman into uncharted waters. Johnathan fears for the worst when Freddy lands in the icy Bering Sea. On the Wizard, Captain Keith tempts fate, risking thousands in crab gear right at the ice edge.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Catch: Bloodline
programme.desc: Inspired by Phil's love of history, Josh, Casey and Johnathan Hillstrand brave unknown waters in the dead of night to try their hand at the ancient Hawaiian Ika-Shibi fishing technique.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Dog Who Won Jeff's Heart
programme.desc: A cat with a shattered paw needs Dr. Jeff's help to walk again. Dr. Baier treats a rescued opossum in need of a new home. And the team heads to an Indian reservation in South Dakota, where a badly injured dog steals Jeff's heart.(n)

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: To save a puppy's leg, Dr. Jeff tackles a surgical procedure he's never done before. A ferret bites off more than he can chew. Dr. Don makes a disturbing discovery when treating a rescued cat.(n)

programme.title: Too Cute!
programme.desc: Star-struck Snow is a Great Pyrenees puppy who dreams of following in her movie star mom's paw prints. A pair of Border Collie pups will need to be brave if they're going to be champion herders. And a Scottish Terrier tries to win over the resident cat.(n)

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Emile and Mike can't leave their cats alone as one will viciously attack the other. The couple is at their breaking point with the bloody attacks. Justin and Susanne can’t agree on how to handle their energetic Bengal cat who constantly attacks.(n)

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: Queensland's Cape York is considered one of the last wild frontiers in Australia. Steve and Terri set out on a journey along some of the most treacherous roads and remote rivers to reach the northernmost tip of the country.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: It's graduation day for the fledgling penguins that have spent six months in their nursery being cared for by the keepers.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: Get a first look at the series that gives you an all-access pass to one of the world's most venerated zoos.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The staff is hopeful for a successful breeding season when Mshango the giraffe meets the females of the herd. Power tools are needed for an Amur tiger's root canal, while Louie the swan falls ill, jeopardizing his release.(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: A family in Independence, OH who run a hope center want to build a therapeutic space in the trees. Believing in the healing power of trees and treehouses, Pete builds a butterfly-themed treehouse in a cluster of 6 trees featuring a climbing net and loft.(n)

programme.title: Tanked!
programme.desc: Lusso Auto Spa designs customizations for high end and rare vehicles, now they want an exotic fish tank that matches their automobiles. They've requested a massive 14 foot, three sided wonder that will sit amidst their multi-million dollar cars.(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: A Pennsylvania prison offers to take twenty dogs from Villalobos. An emaciated pit bull fights for its life. A potential adopter travels from Michigan to meet a dog that stole her heart, but then is shocked when she comes face to face.(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Tia and M2 welcome back a couple who want to reunite their adoptee with her former best friend. Mariah and Tony discover a hound in desperate shape, while Mariah does everything in her power to nurse VRC's first Louisiana rescue back to health.(n)

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: With oyster season in full swing, Texas game wardens ensure everyone is following the rules on land and water. Hunters are investigated for trespassing on private property. The game wardens find an oyster boat deckhand with several warrants.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy heads to remote wetlands to investigate reports of a brutal riverside mutilation where he comes face to face with one of South America's greatest freshwater fighters and uncovers the slasher stalking Argentina's River of Blood.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to Brazil's wild west in search of a river monster that has killed three cowboys. Jeremy finally corners his elusive prey in the most unexpected place. All he has to do then is catch it, without getting killed.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: The biggest bull shark ever recorded was caught in South Africa, in a river. Could this monstrous freshwater catch be a fluke, or are there more shark giants prowling this river. Jeremy Wade heads to South Africa to see if he can land a monster.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Wade seeks a dangerous lake monster from native legends.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters: Deadliest Man-Eaters
programme.desc: In the heart of Central America, anglers have been victim to a man-sized aquatic killer and Jeremy Wade is determined to find the culprit. In the Pacific Northwest, Jeremy battles a thundering waterfall in search of an ancient river monster.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: The Mekong River is well known for its monstrous fish. This time, Jeremy is drawn to the spot in Southeast Asia after reports of something that has sliced cleanly through a young man's testicle.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to the Paran River in the remote corner of Argentina to investigate the death of a young girl. This creature is not armed with bone crunching jaws or razor sharp teeth, but a razor-sharp blade tipped with tissue destroying venom.(n)

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: When a puppy is found abandoned with a broken leg, Dr. Jeff is his only hope to walk again.(n)

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.sub-title: The Heart of a Pit Bull
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff performs emergency surgery on a pit bull and makes a surprising discovery. Dr. Baier treats a goat kicked by a horse. A couple drives all night hoping the team can fix their dog's shattered leg. And Dr. Baier and Hector treat an injured ostrich.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.sub-title: The Disappearance of the Warty Pig
programme.desc: Visayan warty pig Wendy is fed up with the attentions of male pig Jake and decides to escape. She can't be found overnight, despite a major search by the keepers.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Matrah the cheetah is shunned by his two brothers after starting to show signs of injury. He is taken to the vet to figure out what's wrong, but the brotherly reunion doesn't go as planned, so keepers fear they may have to separate them.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Blue Poison dart frog Bertha loves to wrestle. The zoo would like to breed her, but she's scared off all potential suitors. The keeps introduce some new young male frogs, in hope that one of them will be strong enough.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Reticulated pythons, 'Jodie Foster' and Bali, are two of the most dangerous animals at the zoo. When a window is broken in their habitat, keepers have to find a way of distracting these man-eating creatures so that the repair work can be completed.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Otter couple Diego and Icana are best friends but have never mated, so keepers decide to replace Diego with a new male Tarubu. They hope that young Tarubu will relight Icana's fire and that they will provide Chester with long awaited otter pups.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Baby flamingo Marley's mom has lost interest in mothering duties leaving dad, Rum, to rear the baby alone. Parenting duties are normally shared equally by flamingo parents, but Rum will have to do the work of two parents if his son is going to endure.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Crate training Nikita the Amur tiger in preparation for her move to Washington, DC proves challenging. An endangered Chinese alligator shows signs of being pregnant. Plus, staff prepare to release rare New England cottontail rabbits into the wild.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A sweet giraffe named Mashengo journeys from the Indiana Zoo to his new home in the Bronx. Keepers hand-raise endangered ducklings and release them onto the duck pond at the Central Park Children's Zoo. Plus, love is in the air for a pair of cloud rats.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Cardiologists try to determine why the geladas are experiencing a life-threatening heart condition. Keepers shift the Nile crocodiles off exhibit for a maintenance project. Later, after a shaky start, the elephant shrews are breeding.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: One team tests the problem solving skills of lions against those of snow leopards. Willow, a young red panda, is having mysterious foot problems. Also, the bird department anxiously awaits the gender reveal of two new adjutant stork chicks.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Iray, a red ruffed lemur, is rushed to the health center when keepers discover a wound on his leg. A new exhibit is built for the Pallas's cats, the original grumpy cats. Plus, seven adorable baby turtles join the zoo's colony of an endangered species.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: An okapi called Magani is ready to breed and is paired with veteran Kweli to learn the ropes. Lola the blue iguana plays hard-to-get when introduced to a potential mate, and anteater Velcro shows off her talents with a new tool.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A charismatic ostrich named Olga works to be reunited with her flock. Buster the squirrel monkey is introduced to the zoo's troop of feisty females. A functionally extinct species of turtle finds new life, and everyone's favorite warthog is back.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: After taking over the former red river hog habitat, a gazelle gives the team a big surprise. Staffers race to prepare a den when they suspect the amur leopard Satka is pregnant, and koalas are nursed back to health after being saved from the bushfires.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: When lesser flamingo eggs and chicks are being preyed upon, the team must make a nerve-wracking decision. Wallaby Thelma and her joey Everest become ambassador animals, and a new perch is created for Stuart, the young fishing cat.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego - California Tales
programme.desc: Staff develop an innovative course of treatment when cheetah Amara shows signs of injury. The zoo becomes host to the only pair of platypuses outside Australia. And, a new team of falcon trainers show off their skills.(n)

programme.title: Beast Buddies
programme.desc: A fearless man puts his trust into jaw-snapping gators; another daredevil man swims with baby bears and wrestles with large lions, while a woman's way to relaxation is with a pit of snakes.(n)

programme.title: Beast Buddies

programme.title: Planet Earth: Enchanted Kingdom
programme.desc: Narrated by Idris Elba, explore seven distinct worlds in the wildest continent on Earth, Africa, to discover that nature is so much more surprising and extraordinary than ever imagined.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The summer melt of Arctic ice provides opportunities for millions of animals, including narwhal, beluga whales, families of Arctic foxes and vast colonies of seabirds. But for polar bears, it's the toughest time of year.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: A spectacular natural event takes place in North America every year as hundreds of millions of salmon return from the Pacific Ocean to the mountain streams where they were born. The salmon must overcome fierce torrents and leap over waterfalls.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: Each year, over a million wildebeest and zebra invade the Serengeti grasslands making it a paradise for the predators that live there. We follow the moving story of one lion family's struggle to survive.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The Sardine Run is the world's largest gathering of predators; each winter a mighty army of ocean predators hunt the sardines gathering along South Africa's eastern coast; with the Run becoming less stable it has effects that run right up the food chain.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The yearly flood of the Okavango Delta turns 4,000 square miles of arid plains into wetland.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: Every summer in the seas off Alaska, humpback whales, sea lions and killer whales depend on an explosion of plant life: the plankton bloom. It transforms these seas into the richest on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Reptiles and amphibians live on every continent except Antarctica. From icy wastelands to arid deserts, they outnumber mammals and birds, and their extraordinary forms and bizarre behaviour are constantly surprising.(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Witness the secret and ferocious world of the great white and sailfish, the puffer fish and barracuda, in this extraordinary journey from open ocean to coral reef and from storm-ravaged surf zone to the abyssal depths.(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Using the latest techniques and remote-controlled 'ant-cams', enter the world of armoured-plated insects, spiders and scorpions.(n)

programme.title: Life
